title: Handle 429 (Too many requests) errors without Retry-After headers and in batch transactions

labels.name: status:ready
labels.description: This issue is ready to be worked on

body: Tagging @kamil2806 as he brought this issue to my attention
Wow, thanks a lot @kowalski. This makes sense.

hi @fvictorio 
I was wondering if there is a chance to have these changes incorporated into hardhat.
We're still relying on local modifications of hardhat code in node_modules in our project and I'd love to get rid of this if possible.
Please let me know if I can help.
Hey @kowalski, sorry for not responding before, it's been a busy couple of weeks. I'll try to prioritize this and get it fixed either this week or (more likely) the next week.

Hi @kowalski. I opened #3895, that fixes the first part of this issue. Thanks a lot for the diff with the solution! I tested it locally, creating a server that returns 429 errors with and without the header, and it worked fine.

Now, with respect to the second part... I believe this is an error on Alchemy's side. They should return a full 429 error in that case; returning it within a batched response doesn't make sense. I just contacted them about this.

I think your solution makes sense, but I'm a bit reluctant to add a somewhat complex code, in a part of the codebase that it's hard to test automatically, to fix a third-party bug. I hope you understand! And I'm willing to reconsider this in the future if it turns out to be the only solution.

I totally understand.
And also, I agree that this behavior looks like Alchemy bug.
I did try to contact them on their Discord support channel, but I've never heard back.
And it was quite a few months ago.... but will see, maybe they will respond to your message. 
Thanks!
